title: Rustc suggests the same method twice when a mismatched type is found

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

labels.name: D-verbose
labels.description: Too much output caused by a single piece of incorrect code

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
let what_rustc_thinks = clean::Item::from_def_id_and_parts(did, Some(name), kind, cx);
```

I expected to see this happen: Rustc suggests `name.to_string()`.

Instead, this happened:

```
error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> src/librustdoc/clean/inline.rs:127:74
    |
127 |     let what_rustc_thinks = clean::Item::from_def_id_and_parts(did, Some(name), kind, cx);
    |                                                                          ^^^^ expected struct `std::string::String`, found struct `Symbol`
    |
help: try using a conversion method
    |
127 |     let what_rustc_thinks = clean::Item::from_def_id_and_parts(did, Some(name.to_string()), kind, cx);
    |                                                                          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
127 |     let what_rustc_thinks = clean::Item::from_def_id_and_parts(did, Some(name.to_string()), kind, cx);
    |                                                                          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version`: rustc 1.48.0-beta.3 (4708ac76e 2020-10-15)
